remarks: If any atom (under ` W ` ) is not equal to its translation, so is any other atom.  TODO: ` -. P .<_ W ` isn't needed to prove this.  Will removing it shorten (and not lengthen) proofs using it?  (Contributed by NM, 6-May-2013.)
statement:
ltrn2eq.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
ltrn2eq.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
ltrn2eq.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
ltrn2eq.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
ltrnatneq $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( F e. T /\ ( P e. A /\ -. P .<_ W ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ -. Q .<_ W ) ) /\ ( F ` P ) =/= P ) -> ( F ` Q ) =/= Q ) $.
